This club will benefit anyone who joins, give them great experience, allow for more job opportunities, and overall it will be outright fun for anyone who wants to create projects daily.
Website:https://sites.google.com/view/ml-blog16draft/homeEmail:machinelearningofhunter@gmail.com
Provide minority pre-medical students with networking, volunteering, shadowing and research opportunities to fulfill the goal of diversifying the biomedical field.

1) combat elitism, increase equitability and promote accessibility in computer coding and programming,(2) bolster student portfolios and prepare students for a future in computer science, and(3) improve adoption of Open Source Software among technical students, professors and creatives.

The purposes of oSTEM at Hunter are to establish an inclusive and supportive community for LGBTQ+ STEM students, to educate and promote awareness of LGBTQ+ health issues, and to promote LGBTQ+ visibility in STEM field.

The overarching aim of the club is to maintain a community of students for the exchange of philosophical ideas in the conviction that learning and philosophy are one and the same pursuit. The invitation of ideas from individuals of every discipline and background is furthermore to be encouraged, for philosophy need not be restricted by the institutions and traditions that have gathered around it. Students intending to pursue careers in academic scholarship and teaching in philosophy are of special interest to the club. Efforts are made to orient and otherwise prepare students by providing information about the kinds of challenges experienced by professionals living and working in the field.

The purpose of the Political Science Association club is to represent the interests and needs of students interested in Political Science to the Political Science Department. As well as arrange social and intellectual discussions on academic topics relating to Political Science. PSA exists to promote student activities in which we gain knowledge of political philosophy, comparative, domestic and international politics. Accomplished by establishing events, trips, and hosting forums for political speakers (lawyers, politicians, authors, and professors). Our group boasts a wide variety of perspectives from all different backgrounds. This club is unique in that we offer a non-hostile environment where we respect each other’s views. We welcome anyone interested.
To provide pertinent resources, support, information, guidance, and a sense of community to current and prospective post-baccalaureate students.
SEEDs is a group focused on promoting the field of ecology, sustainability, and environmental sciences at Hunter College.

The purpose of SPA is to encourage and facilitate the knowledge and understanding of Physics and Astronomy in varying formal and informal settings as well as hold activities that increase interest in and knowledge of both aforementioned fields.

BDP at HC is a student-led group that partners with the 501(c)3 non-profit charity Bangladesh Development Project to fundraise, advocate, spread awareness, and aid, on behalf of men, women and children of Bangladesh. Furthermore, this club serves as a space for students who care about Bangladesh to discuss their visions for Bangladesh’s development. The club is supported by the non-profit Bangladesh Development Project’s staff and it will be part of one of many future campaigns. The purpose of BDP-HC is to shed light on the injustices imposed on underprivileged children in Bangladesh, unjust labor laws, unequal educational opportunities, and healthcare inequities by fundraising for various causes and to raise awareness regarding the above mentioned key topics.

The mission of Blood Initiative of Hunter is to work towards ending blood shortages to prevent more unnecessary deaths. The purpose of this University Blood Initiative (UBI) Chapter, therefore, is to empower the local community blood center by increasing the participation of Hunter students. Furthermore, BIH would hold educational events to raise awareness of the current blood shortage and blood disorders. BIH will be benefiting the Hunter community through incentives such as discounts through partnerships with various organizations.

GRADUATE CLUBS.club_name: Effective Altruism Club at Hunter College
club_description: The purpose of this club is to promote awareness of the social movement/philosophy of Effective Altruism while also engaging in discourse about how to help people in the most resourceful and efficient ways possible. The club will facilitate discussion between individuals regarding value systems, cause prioritization, and career choices. The goal is to gain support for Effective Altruism while simultaneously exploring different, important questions about how to help the world.
Provide a safe and educational space for the LGBTQIA+ students of Hunter College. Hold events that bring the community together and provide resources for the community.
Provide a safe and educational space for the LGBTQIA+ students of Hunter College. Hold events that bring the community together and provide resources for the community.

GRADUATE CLUBS.club_name: National Alzheimer’s Buddies at Hunter College
club_description: The National Alzheimer’s Buddies are a national organization that connects undergraduate students to patients diagnosed with Alzheimer’s Disease. Through our chapter we will be able to coordinate with nearby Dementia-Care facilities to pair students with patients, creating influential friendships and easing a lot of the social isolation that comes with Alzheimer’s Disease. The National Alzheimer’s Buddies seek to alleviate the often-overlooked emotional and social challenges that stem from Alzheimer’s by building friendships between college students and Alzheimer’s residents that bring out the beauty of the person still present.

Peer Health Exchange’s mission is to empower young people with the knowledge, skills and resources to make healthy decisions. We do this by training college students to teach a skills-based health curriculum in under-resourced high schools.

The purpose of STF at Hunter College is to fight for a world where every girl chooses her own future. We team up with local organizations to make sure girls are educated, respected, and heard. STF at Hunter College raises awareness on girls’ rights and education, hosts fundraisers, and builds a community of gender equality advocates.

The purpose of the Sustainability Project is to educate the Hunter community about sustainability in a variety of forms. We seek to spread awareness about environmental issues, teach people how to reduce their environmental impact, and how each individual’s choice can affect the environment on a larger scale. We hope to educate and inform about sustainable growth, which meets the needs of the present without compromising the capacity of future generations to meet their own needs.

UNICEF Campus Initiative and High School Clubs are grassroots, student-led groups that partner with the U.S. Fund for UNICEF to educate, advocate and fundraise on behalf of children and in support of UNICEF’s lifesaving work. The clubs are supported by U.S. Fund for UNICEF staff and by a student-led National Council. The purpose of the UNICEF Initiative at Hunter College is to fundraise for various causes and raise awareness regarding UNICEF-related issues.
The purpose of the organization shall be to promote the rich culture, language, customs and traditions of the Albanian people.

The purpose of this club is to give students of Arab descent at Hunter the space to celebrate and share their culture with the rest of the Arab community; while also introducing Arab culture to the rest of campus to promote unity and inclusivity.

The purpose of Asian Students in Action shall be to: (1) aid the growth and development of Hunter College collegiate students through culturally, socially, and academically focused programming about the Asian community, (2) provide a positive learning environment for students, faculty, and staff at Hunter College, (3) promote diversity and unity within the Hunter College community, (4) provide community service, campus involvement, and professional development opportunities to its members, (5) increase the visibility and involvement of Asian students on campus and in the surrounding community and (6) provide an opportunity for students to come together and discuss issues pertaining to Asia.

The Balkan region of the world is one that is rich with culture and tradition that derives from many origins. The goal of the Balkan club is to create a safe space to discuss all that the people of the Balkan region face. We aim to provide students with a better understanding of the Balkan Culture, region, language(s), customs and traditions, and issues that we face. We want students to become more culturally aware of the Balkan nations and their history. The goal of the club is to promote unity amongst the Balkan population on campus, although we do target the Balkan population, we do encourage all Hunter students to join the club and contribute to the lively conversations and events the club plans on hosting.
The aims and objectives of the C.S.U. shall be as follows

The main purpose of this club is to create a space for students to foster their own personal development not only with regards to their understanding of Chinese language and culture, but also on a professional level. This club will serve as a place where members can learn about a culture different from their own, meet students with common interests, participate in activities and events and practice Mandarin. The club will open students up to new opportunities, expand their knowledge about the world around them, promote leadership qualities and resume building experiences and prepare them for the world at large.

Chinese students are minority groups at Hunter College; the purpose of establishing the Chinese Student Union is to provide them the opportunity to expand their social network. The mission of the club is to provide those Chinese students with academic aid and personal help.

CSSA is a small group of people who have been brought together by fate, we want to start a club to pursue our goals. Our Club will build a complementary platform for students who are interested in Chinese culture and promote Chinese culture to students with different backgrounds. It’s a community for students to cherish their culture. Our club members come from different majors and will find friends with similar interests, which will help students better integrate into college life and to some extent help their mental health.

GRADUATE CLUBS.club_name: Eugenio Maria de Hostos Puerto Rican and Multicultural Club
club_description: A safe space for family to enrich our cultures. Several events are held throughout the year, and the room is a space for discussion and games.

The general purpose of this organization is to provide an in-depth look into the various cultures of countries and groups that identify with the Francophone Culture. Students will be able to learn some of the Francophone language and delve into holidays, cuisine, traditions, media, and customs within these Francophone nations and their history. One of the running themes and major points would be that France is not the only country that speaks French, hence the indication that it has a Francophone culture. That being said, this club will focus on traditions from Francophone countries all over the world. Another purpose of this club will be to offer the chance to experience Francophone culture in NYC through excursions. The goal of this club is to educate and excite students about the Francophone culture and language.

The purpose of the German Club of Hunter College is to enrich other students on one of the largest cultures/languages in the world, German. We will help achieve this by interacting with technology and the real world.

The mission and purpose of the Haitian Students Association (“HSA”, “the Association”, “the Club”, “the Organization”) is to 1) unite Haitian and non-Haitian students together through the exploration of Haitian culture, identity, & politics, 2) abolish stereotypes and misconceptions of the Haitian people and culture by means of education through panels, seminars, meetings, and other social functions, 3) support and promote social development through group activities, 4) establish stronger ties between Haitian students and faculties, 5) create leaders and world changers by providing its members with the leadership skills necessary to excel beyond their college career, and 6) promote a civic involvement culture amongst HSA members.

To foster an appreciation of the Italian language and culture through uniting a multi-cultural and diverse student body. In addition to heighten awareness regarding the Italian experience in America. To provide the Hunter community with an enhanced understanding of the culture through an array of initiatives such as lectures, symposiums, film screenings, dialogical conversation, performing arts, and other modes of expression. Finally, to facilitate social engagement of Italian culture within the Hunter College community.

We want to promote awareness and appreciation of Polish culture at Hunter College since there is no other school in New York that has a higher Polish population than Hunter College. We want to bring everyone who loves Polish culture together and we will be a club that will reflect an important part of a student and help reaffirm their own identity by sharing traditions and values.

The purpose of the Russian Club is to enrich students with knowledge of Russian culture and traditions by way of cultural events, such as, but not limited to, films, food, outings, discussions, and guest speakers. We will offer this opportunity to club members via on-campus events and throughout New York City.

Section I – To improve and practice the Spanish language and Hispanic culture within Hunter College.Section II – To improve communications and cooperation among student organizations.Section III – To encourage good character, leadership, and academic success within the Department of Romance Languages.Section IV – To promote experiences in a democratic form of government.

The purpose of the club is to promote interest and an understanding of Taiwanese culture within the student body. There will be an environment in which students of all backgrounds can appreciate and learn more about their cultures through a mutual understanding.

To introduce Christianity to students of Hunter College, to help members understand more about Christianity, to build up one another, and provide a place for Christian students of Hunter College to have weekly meetings.

The purpose of this club is to learn about and embrace Coptic heritage. Copts were the last remaining native Egyptians before the Arab invasion of Egypt during the 7th century. Their heritage continued through their intermarriage within their own communities. Today, about 15% of Egypt is comprised of Copts and they are associated with Orthodox Christianity. Therefore they are an ethnoreligious group. Their language is still in use today in the Coptic Orthodox Church. Members will learn about Copts and participate in activities that are related to the Coptic Culture and Heritage. They will come together to create a sense of community and belonging at hunter college.

To facilitate weekly space committed to American Sign Language and culture learning, taught by members of the Deaf/Hard of Hearing community, and use of university club funding to make sure instructors are adequately compensated for their labor. We will ensure that the space is universally designed and intentionally inclusive of all disabled people including multiply-disabled people and multiply-marginalized people.

The mission of this organization is to support the program of Animal Behavior and Conservation in the Psychology Department at Hunter College. This club will serve as a space to discuss research and research proposals, homework issues, share ideas, and provide assistance on future class recommendations. As this program attracts many commuters and part-time students who are otherwise employed full-time, this club will serve as a forum to help students familiarize themselves with the Animal Behavior and Conservation program and come together to share their collective interest in this field.

This club is designed to provide Hunter College’s Graduate students with both collective information from its student body as well as have a consistent contact with faculty to make sure all counseling program information is accurate and available. The club also aims to serve it’s students in a number of ways such as: leadership growth, mentorship and job opportunities, skills training and will also provide a form for its members to voice their needs/concerns.

EYEspeak is a student club associated with the IMA Program. The club hosts and facilitates student led events, workshops, and minor equipment purchases. All current students in the IMA program are encouraged to participate.

The purpose of the Global Social Work Alliance is to bring focus to topics related to work with international populations and to support and engage students interested in gaining a better understanding of their practice within a global context.

GRADUATE CLUBS.club_name: Graduate American Sign Language Learning Club
club_description: To facilitate weekly space committed to American Sign Language and culture learning, taught by members of the Deaf/Hard of Hearing community, and use of university club funding to make sure instructors are adequately compensated for their labor. We will ensure that the space is universally designed and intentionally inclusive of all disabled people including multiply-disabled people and multiply-marginalized people.
Email:HunterCUNY.asl@gmail.com

The purpose of the GSRS is to support the academic and professional goals of students enrolled in the Graduate Social Research Program and promote collegiality among students, alumni, faculty and staff.

The Graduate Women in Science Club aims to support the academic and professional goals of women enrolled in graduate­ level science programs at Hunter College, while creating an open and safe environment for the discussion of issues of interest to women in science. There will be workshops aimed at improving research skills, and discussion groups for current science topics of interest.

The purpose of the Macro Social Work Student Network is to develop a geographically diverse network of and for macro-practice social work undergraduate and graduate students to: Share and augment macro practice knowledge; maintain self-awareness of macro practice as a minority method in the social work field; share our work with the rest of the social work field.

The goal of the MFASO is to build community and enrich the culture within the MFA program, to act as representation of students’ concerns to the faculty and administration, and to improve facilities and resources for studio practice.

The purpose of the Mind Body Spirit Alliance is to provide a consistent safe space, or community, for students wherein they can explore, develop, and foster healthy self-care practices that integrate the mind, body, and spirit. The club aims to empower (social work) students in balancing the stressors of academic courses with the demands of field placement by supplying a forum for collaboratively engaging with mindfulness practices, such as meditation and yoga. We wish to expose social work graduate students to a range of traditional and not-so-traditional techniques that may not be covered in regular coursework. This goal is currently accomplished through weekly meetings, largely centered around guided meditations and shared resources. The alliance provides an opportunity for students with similar interests to meet, practice self-care and share relevant ideas and information.

GRADUATE CLUBS.club_name: National Honor Society for Dance Arts
club_description: As noted on NDEO.org: NHSDA is a program of the National Dance Education Organization, created to recognize outstanding artistic merit, leadership, and academic achievement in students studying dance education at the collegiate level.

The mission of the Gender & Sexuality Coalition (GSC) at Silberman School of Social Work is to educate, empower, and promote awareness of the gender and sexuality spectrum throughout cultures, both in school and our surrounding communities. Our goal is to create an environment and set a tone within school surrounding issues of gender and sexuality for professional development, building transparency between faculty and students needs, and to provide students with access to resources on and off campus.

GRADUATE CLUBS.club_name: Student Alliance for an Aging Society (SAAS)
club_description: The purposes of SAAS are: 1. To build interest among Silberman School of Social Work at Hunter College students and staff about the field of gerontology and aging; 2. To foster relationships among Silberman School of Social Work at Hunter College students and with local aging-focused organizations, and; 3. To encourage student engagement in advocacy efforts for older adults.
Our purpose is to garner participation in English academia while increasing undergraduate exposure to various scholarship opportunities and scholarly work.

The Argentine Tango Club is formed by and for tango lovers at Hunter College. We are dedicated to teaching Argentine tango to the students of Hunter College and exposing them to all the benefits that tango has to offer.

The purpose of this organization is to expand the dance of breaking and the Hip-Hop culture within the Hunter College Community. We can accomplish this by sharing our knowledge about not only the dance itself but also its origin and history with anyone who is interested and willing to learn to put in effort. We also want to improve on an individual level as well as a group level in practices so that we can perform and expose our art form to the community through collective representation.

The purpose of this club is to spread awareness about and to form a functional competitive team that focuses on the style of dance called Garba and Raas. This traditional type of dance originated in Gujarat, India. Dance teams, all across America, have recreated this traditional dance and transformed it into something modern and fast-paced. We aim to form a team that is recognized and competes at competitions across the country throughout the year! Dancers need not be of the Indian background, nor do they need any previous dance experience.

Our purpose is to provide instruction in traditional Afro-Haitian drumming for any Hunter College undergraduate student who desires such instruction, and to present a positive image of Haiti through its music. The organization serves the Hunter Community by promoting its diversity.

As Hunter students we constantly face the struggle of balancing our lives and our progression as artists. We believe it is imperative to build a community of like-minded people who want to grow creatively. Our goal is to create an extracurricular immersive environment, which will expand the students’ artistic vocabulary and exposure to multiple perspectives and ideas. HAP’s mission is to support the development of visual artists at Hunter College through group critiques, exhibitions and events.

The purpose of the Hip HopOlogy club aims to educate students about the culture of hip hop dance that started here in NYC. The genres of dance that will be covered are B-Boy/ Girl (also known as Break Dancing) and other styles of Hip Hop that started in the West Coast such as Popping, Locking, Tutting and Waving. I feel it is essential that the Hunter College community learn these revolutionary styles of dance that has changed the dance world. The club will also enhance students’ physical strength and relieve stress using different stretching techniques and breathing exercises.

Live Music Group is an Undergraduate Student Organization at Hunter College. Live Music Group hosts and curates live musical performances in the many Hunter College Performing Arts facilities located throughout the campus.

Through free, one-on-one music lessons, Musical Empowerment at Hunter College nurtures meaningful relationships between Hunter College student mentors and underserved students in public schools based on a shared love of music and learning. The program aims to build a foundation of confidence, creativity and self-discipline to create successful individuals.

The title of this student-coordinated organization is called Rhythm Hitters. Our goal is to collectively connect engaging students who are interested in the art of Dance, more specifically, Hip-Hop dancing. Multi-leveled and differentiated styles of hip-hip dancing will be taught and choreographed within this organization.

Cult. Magazine is for any student interested in culture. We are the place at Hunter where you can express your interests in a published form. Cult. will be an outlet to highlight both Hunter College and the diversity of its student body.

For Your Considerationis a film club and publication that aims to foster and grow the creative community passionate about film and television at Hunter. Through our workshops and events, we’ll explore all aspects of filmmaking and celebrate film as a tangible art form through our publication.

The Journal of Undergraduate Research strives to showcase research conducted by the undergraduate student body, the promotion of science journalism and the promotion of accurate scientific knowledge. Additionally, we hope to inform the student body of the many research programs, seminars and conferences available both at Hunter and in the Greater New York City Area.

GRADUATE CLUBS.club_name: Pre-Health Diaries Blog of Hunter College
club_description: Pre Health Diaries is an online blog and club for students to be informed about different issues in science and medicine, such as the ethics of science in technology and awareness of public health crises. We also offer a space for pre health students to post about their journey, such as challenges, extracurriculars, experiences, and advice they would like to share. We hope to form a more united pre health community where students can connect with others of similar interests, and become strong, informed, and interdisciplinary students of science.
The purpose of Spoon University is to provide college students with the chance to learn, share, and talk about food and wellness via an online publication.

To connect Hunter students to clinical volunteer and research activities. This Club is an extension of the BOLD Program at Albert Einstein College of Medicine. Through this extension, Hunter undergraduates work on fundraisers to help underserved Communities in NYC and gain mentors in Einstein faculty.

Circle K International is a service organization. The club is founded on three tenets of leadership, fellowship, and service. We hope to foster compassion and goodwill toward others through our tenets.

GRADUATE CLUBS.club_name: Gift of Life Bone Marrow Foundation
club_description: The purpose of this club is to spread awareness for the Marrow Registry and to swab college students in order to increase the diversity of the registry. This registry gives patients with blood disorders a second chance at life.
We build strength, stability, and self-reliance through shelter. Seeking to put God’s love into action, Habitat for Humanity brings people together to build homes, communities and hope.

GRADUATE CLUBS.club_name: Knitting for Healing Club of Hunter College
club_description: The purpose of the club is to donate our projects and create an inclusive environment were members can learn a new crafting skill (i.e. Knitting, crochet, embroidery, etc). Projects would be assigned to members and after completion, the project would be distributed to charities that donate these projects to people who need them. Projects such as blankets, scarfs, hats, and caps for premature babies will be collected and donated to the proper charity.

The purpose of the Pencils of Promise Club is for students to be involved in promoting quality education for children in underdeveloped nations. Pencil of Promise organization has already created a difference in Ghana, Guatemala, Laos and Nicaragua by building over 470 schools. Hunter College students will aim to help continue the growth and success of these children’s future. The partnership with Pencils of Promise will help gather students to raise money for the opportunity for other children to receive education.

GRADUATE CLUBS.club_name: The Smart Girls Group of Hunter College
club_description: The purpose of this organization shall be to provide a place where we work together, as a team, to help one another succeed in all facets of life in a unique environment. Over the course of the semester, we each will learn a great deal about ourselves and one another and help each other realize our goals, both long term and short. Our mission is to help our local community and support various issues such as ending sexist oppression. We will hold several fundraisers and events supporting various organizations that will not only give back to the community but also help us grow individually and as a group.
The purpose of Art in Medicine club is to promote artistic components within the medical field to those who are interested in such endeavors.
Instagram:https://www.instagram.com/art_in_medicine_hc/

To localize talent in the variety arts and provide palliative care at hospitals and senior homes through performance. To both provide a place for those interested in the variety arts to share ideas and perform and to provide volunteering opportunities for all students.

The purpose of this club is to create a safe environment for students who are not used to the stressful environment that is college. Our overall goal is to foster a sense of community after being isolated for so long due to Covid, and to provide respite from the taxing workload of college. We seek to help like-minded individuals come together, and to explore the cultures of different students. We will host events such as hobby nights, aiming to explore different hobbies, movie nights, and possible city exploration events aimed to help students experience more of the city. We also want to serve as a networking hub, helping members learn of possible jobs, internships, or volunteering opportunities.
Lights, camera, action!

From the design and production of websites, clothing, accessories, logos, art, to everything that is and can be, the Hunter Design and Production club is the place where dreams are made and shared with anyone who’s interested.
Our goal is to build a community at Hunter that helps students put theory into practice. We have in-person events, technical workshops, interview prep, socials, and more.

The Esports and Game Design Collective is a professional organization in nature, connecting students from different departments and majors that have like-minded interests in games and the games industry. We host events and tournaments, Dungeons & Dragons meetups, and have a library of over 450 games free to use. We hold game design workshops open to all Hunter College students, as well as academic advising for students studying game design at Hunter. We are also home to all of Hunter’s esports teams. We are a registered College League of Legends club, and an academic chapter of the International Game Developers Association.

This organization’s purpose is to allow Hunter Students who play fighting games (primarily at a competitive, but also casual level) a convenient time and place to network and further their performance in said video games of interest.

GRADUATE CLUBS.club_name: Global Surgery Student Alliance at Hunter College
club_description: Our mission is to explore a career in surgery and raise awareness of global medical issues in surgery.

The lack of healthcare literacy is a serious issue facing our communities, and it does not discriminate against socioeconomic status, ethnicity, gender nor level of education. The Healthcare Literacy Initiative will help our community understand and navigate our complicated and often confusing healthcare system by providing seminars and workshops on areas such as health insurance and access to care. By working with local community organizations, we hope to promote a platform for tomorrow’s healthcare providers to have a direct impact on public health today through civic engagement in our campus and community. Access to healthcare is a right, but unfortunately, properly navigating it has become a privilege restricted to few, and with this initiative, we hope to change that.

The purpose of this club is to build a community that allows and encourages students to appreciate the genre of music known as Korean pop, or K-pop for short. We wish to establish a friendly and supportive environment for those who have an interest in this genre to explore it. This will be accomplished by coming together as a group in order to share our interests, while performing various activities related to the genre, such as playing games and learning the choreography of different K-pop songs. The organization hopes to spread and foster the interest of Korean pop music among the Hunter community.

A mock trial is an act or imitation trial, using real legal circumstances, evidence, and witnesses. Attorneys preparing for a real trial will use a mock trial consisting of volunteers as role players to test theories, persuade the jury to rule in favor of the client they are representing, and master the legal side of courtroom proceedings.
To foster a community of Hunter students dedicated to learning more about the Constitution and our Judiciary system.

The purpose of the Rehabilitation Therapy Club is to build a community of students who are interested in occupational therapy, physical therapy, or speech and language pathology. Rehabilitation therapy is oftentimes overshadowed by medical professions. With the establishment of this club, we are able to support and mentor each club member through the graduate application process, find internships and volunteering experiences, and invite guest speakers who can help further spread awareness on this sector of the health and medical workforces.

To both revive civility in political discourse and to promote Liberal Democratic principles to the student body of Hunter College. An emphasis is placed on using discussion events to bring back intellectual humility, scale back absolutism, protect ourselves from repeating history’s worst mistakes, and debating not to win – but to develop better ideas.

GRADUATE CLUBS.club_name: Rescuing Leftover Cuisine at Hunter College:
club_description: RLC is a non-profit organization that aims to reduce food waste by collecting excess food from restaurants and transporting them to nearby homeless shelters and community centers with the help of volunteers.

The Accounting Society of Hunter College aims to enhance the professional, academic, and social lives of its members. The fundamental goals of the society are to establish a professional culture and facilitate networking among the Hunter College accounting students, faculty, and industry professionals through speaker engagement events, career-building workshops, and community service. The Accounting Society strives to educate its members about current accounting and business issues, while simultaneously helping its members learn the hard and soft skills required to become successful business professionals and community leaders in today’s competitive business environment.

ABS serves as an informational and developmental forum for students interested in learning more about the interdisciplinary fields of business. ABS strives to unite members of diverse scholastic backgrounds and expose them to various business career-paths available to any majors.

HONOR SOCIETIES.club_name: Bachelor of Fine Arts Student Organization
club_description: To engage in outreach and to create workshops helping students understand the role of a BFA degree. To help and guide students who are submitting BFA applications. To create transparency around the BFA application process, and make public the names of accepted students. To host guest lectures, gallery visits and studio visits specifically targeted to students at 68th St, lead and organized by current BFA members. To advocate for the needs of current BFA students.

We aim to provide a general and inclusive space for interested students in all fields of Computer Science while providing them with the skills necessary to pursue a related career through the form of weekly meetings, practical projects, workshops, and guides.

HONOR SOCIETIES.club_name: CUNY Edge Club of Hunter College
club_description: The CUNY EDGE club is an extension of CUNY EDGE’s core values and will host programming that aligns with the CUNY EDGE Program. The club is beneficial to our members’ academic, professional, and personal growth. All CUNY EDGE participants who are interested in leadership opportunities, passionate about helping their peers, inspired to empower others, and eager to jump-start their networking pursuits are welcome to join the club.

The CUNY EDGE Club aims to develop strong leadership skills amongst its members. Students from diverse backgrounds will come together from an array of majors to network, encouraging each other to become more diverse thinkers – all while preparing them for real-life scenarios and supporting their professional development. The club will give a new meaning to living life on the edge!

The purpose of this club is to help increase access to resources, enrichment opportunities, counseling and mentorship to Latino pre-med students. Having this establishment will help Latino students identify with others with similar backgrounds and will help them share their journey towards medicine. By working with Weill Cornell’s already existing LMSA chapter we anticipate to have a closer relationship with the facility and faculty members that would further allow our students to connect with current medical students and network with physicians and residents of similar Latin roots.

The Medical History Society is a space where students will b able to delve into the rich history of medicine, to learn about the evolution of medical practices, treatments, and technologies over time.

Through preservation of knowledge and interdisciplinary learning members we will be able to raise awareness about the importance of understanding medical history in the context of modern healthcare and medical ethics.

The Medical Laboratory Science Club is dedicated to learning and developing professionalism while providing gateways to become better scientists. To build a beneficial environment and support all members academically as well as mentally to enhance their academic performances in class. To also provide rigorous curriculum, and transformational learning experiences in a dynamic and inclusive scholarly environment.

The purpose of the Hunter-Bellevue Student Nurses Association (HBSNA) is to provide activities and functions that contribute to the fundamental and professional development of future nurses. The organization aims to unite students and faculty alike to create a stimulating, productive and fun environment that will promote school unity and cohesion.

The purpose of the Pre-Dental Society is to provide opportunities and guidance for pre-dental students at Hunter College. We organize events to foster the growth of pre-dental students at Hunter College. Additionally, we provide opportunities for students that are critical for the dental school application process.

The purpose of the Pre-Health Organization is to 1.) Provide Pre-Health students of all various academic backgrounds with information and skills necessary to make them strong applicants for pre-health graduate schools. 2.) To be the conduit between the pre-health students, pre-health advisors, and the administrators of various health professional schools. 3.) To build a network and team of students that will build and sustain their community through various acts of connection and community service.

The purpose of this club is to enrich the academic and professional development of undergraduate students by equipping them with knowledge, skills, and experiences that will produce competitive candidates for professional health-related programs, who are better prepared to become successful participants in various health and graduate professions.

The Pre-Law Society fosters an extracurricular environment for students on the pre-law track or interested in learning about law school. It also supports Hunter College’s Pre-Law Office and its director with event coordination, promotion, and execution. We are responsible for coordinating the annual law school trip and have meetings every week.

The purpose of this organization is to enrich the academic and professional development of Hunter College students who are interested in the field of optometry. This club is for both students who aspire for a potential career in optometry or are just looking for a way to broaden their career options. The means by which this organization will achieve the academic enrichment of its members will be by providing them with an abundance of knowledge, professional resources, experiences, and skills. Different shadowing opportunities and research programs related to this field will be offered to the club’s members. This club also plans on providing first-hand experience to its members by adding a community service component.

Our mission is to provide the pre-PA students of Hunter College a community where they can engage with their fellow pre-PA peers, while giving them the knowledge and opportunities that will better prepare them for the pre-PA path. We aim to prepare students for the application process, guide them through meaningful workshops, and allow them to explore different aspects of the PA career.

The purpose of the club is to provide support to students who are looking or are taking the steps in applying to veterinary school. We are a club that would provide the steps in applying, building a strong application and to aid them in any questions they need. We would provide group activities that would aid them in their application process.

The purpose of the Psychology Club is to facilitate a cohesive social group aimed at providing students with an opportunity to gain a greater appreciation for the discipline of psychology, and to facilitate the dissemination of relevant information for matters of concern to members.

To represent the academic and professional goals of students enrolled in the undergraduate Public Health (PH) program or Nutrition and Food Science (NFS) program by bringing awareness of urban public health issues and resources to the Hunter College community. In addition, we aim to create a community that brings together Public Health and Nutrition and Food Science majors to assist and support each other on our academic journey

American Cancer Society is dedicated to helping people who face cancer. Our purpose is to provide support, encourage prevention, promote a healthy lifestyle, foster innovation, discuss cancer disparities, and share stories of researchers and cancer survivors. By working with the nationwide American Cancer Society, we plan to raise awareness of current cancer research and discuss risk, prevention, and screening methods to eliminate cancer. American Cancer Society at Hunter College seeks to create awareness of the deadly disease among students at Hunter College and assist cancer patients by hosting fundraisers and volunteer events and providing them with numerous resources.

HONOR SOCIETIES.club_name: Asian Pacific American Medical Student Association of Hunter College
club_description: The Asian Pacific American Medical Student Association of Hunter College is a community of Hunter College student leaders dedicated to exploring and addressing the unique health challenges of Asian and Pacific Islander American communities to improve their overall well-being. We strive to empower Asian and Pacific Islander American pre-health students to develop personally and professionally through leadership and service, and provide a platform for students to network with industry professionals, Hunter College students, and faculty. APAMSA of Hunter College also promotes the dissemination of information regarding Asian and Pacific Islander American issues in medicine.

Best Buddies at Hunter College is a part of Best Buddies International, a nonprofit that creates opportunities for friendships between people with and without intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD). Our chapter works with the school and Best Buddies staff to follow the organization’s mission and rules, as well as the school’s regulations for clubs. We’re here to make a lively community where students connect with IDD individuals, making real friendships and learning from each other. Through planned activities, we’ll bond, understand, and accept one another, all while growing personally and as leaders. This is a chance to change lives in meaningful ways.

HONOR SOCIETIES.club_name: Catholic Medical Mission Board (CMMB x Hunter)
club_description: The CMMB x Hunter Club partners with CMMB, a global health nonprofit organization, to advocate and bring attention to the lack of proper healthcare women and children face in the developing world.

We hope to help educate students, raise awareness levels, fundraise, and provide practical, real-life experience for students with interests in pre-health, public policy, international relations, and public health.

HONOR SOCIETIES.club_name: Coalition for the Revitalization of Asian American Studies of Hunter College (CRAASH)
club_description: The club’s purpose is to create a safe space for Hunter students who may identify as Asian American to share their experiences and learn about Asian American history and inform students of current courses, faculty, and resources Hunter has to offer.

Doctors Without Borders /Médecins Sans Frontières(MSF) is an international, independent, medical humanitarian organization that delivers emergency aid to people affected by armed conflict, epidemics, natural disasters, and exclusion from healthcare. MSF offers assistance to people based on need, irrespective of race, religion, gender, or political affiliation. The purpose of this student chapter is to spread knowledge and raise awareness regarding MSF’s work in the field and about humanitarian issues. We expect to involve our fellow students in non-governmental organizations such as MSF through advocacy campaigns.

The purpose of the club is to create a space for people who are/or support undocumented students and their families, and provide them with information and resources as well as emotional support. The club will give undocumented students a place to come out and feel free within their own school.

The club’s purpose is to cultivate a community that makes women feel more confident in their STEM career pursuits. We will practice things like public speaking, leadership skills, as well as provide networking opportunities and how to manage stress due to being in the STEM field.

We are a diverse group of professionals, faculty, alumni and students affiliated with the Department of Geography and Environmental Science at Hunter College in NYC. Our mission is to provide a platform for members to actively participate in projects, events and other activities in environmental science and sustainable development. We seek to promote intellectual and professional development through discussion, interdisciplinary collaboration and external networks.

Hear Your Song, Inc. is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that empowers children and teens with serious illnesses and complex health needs to make their voices heard through collaborative songwriting. Kids living with significant health challenges need the chance to show the world — and sometimes to hear for themselves, too — that they are more than their diagnoses.

In live, collaborative songwriting sessions, Hear Your Song volunteers work with children and teens to guide them through the process of writing their own song lyrics. Using the kid songwriter’s ideas for musical style, melody, instrumentation, and tempo, volunteer composers and musicians then set those words to music and record the song to be heard, celebrated, and shared.

Heart at Hunter aims to help provide interested students with knowledge of key cardiovascular and heart issues. Through awareness/education, advocacy, and fundraising, the club will help support the mission of the American Heart Association (AHA) and the heart community by educating the college community about heart issues, encourage students to be leaders through advocating important issues for legislation with congressmen, while helping to give back through raising money to help fund AHA’s programs and research. We hope to bring passionate students a new perspective of medicine with the field of cardiology and give them a unique community service experience by being heart health advocates.
To discuss the issues of civil rights and liberties, immigrant rights, gay rights and Marxist sociological theory.

The mission of the Latino Medical Student Association of Hunter College is to unite and empower current and future physicians through service, mentorship, and education to advocate for the improved health of the Hispanic & Latino community in the United States

The purpose of Music is Medicine is for Hunter College student musicians to provide musical performances for patients in the hospital. Our goal is to alleviate stress and combat clinical conditions such as delirium. We collaborate with several Manhattan hospitals including Lenox Hill, Mount Sinai, and New York Presbyterian/Weill Cornell. For pre-health students, this club serves as a creative outlet outside of the STEM schedule and a collaborative environment aiming to foster a sense of community.

Our goal is to raise mental health awareness on campus, reduce the stigma of mental illness, and encourage a healthy discussion on various mental health topics. We will also work to foster a supportive community at Hunter College and to increase awareness of the mental health services available at Hunter College and in the communities.

HONOR SOCIETIES.club_name: Palestine Solidarity Alliance of Hunter College
club_description: The Palestine Solidarity Alliance intends to strengthen alliance between the Palestinian people and minorities here within the United States, highlighting the intersectionality of their struggles. As a club, students will advocate for the Boycott, Divestment and Sanctions movement that was called for by Palestinian civil society to demand that Israel comply with international law and end its long list of human rights abuses against the Palestinian people. We will host events on campus such as study groups, events with keynote speakers, discussions, and film-screenings.

HONOR SOCIETIES.club_name: Pre-Health for Human Rights Society at Hunter
club_description: The Pre-Health for Human Rights Society was inspired by the non-profit organization Physicians for Human Rights. Our purpose is to work at the intersection of medicine, science, and law to secure human rights and justice for all. In particular, health professionals are uniquely positioned to prevent serious human rights violations. We aim to really bring light to many of the human rights issues occurring around us and globally, as well as creating a welcoming space for pre-health students who are interested in interdisciplinary studies. PHHR aims to focus on the relationship between people, society, human rights, and medicine by collaborating with human rights agencies to provide volunteer, internship, and research opportunities for students interested in human rights and health professions.

The purpose of this club is to serve as a chapter of Project HOPE, a charitable organization that partners with communities, healthcare systems, and physicians to heal people and save lives, while empowering healthcare workers to create a healthier, more equitable world. Project HOPE responds to a wide array of international and domestic healthcare issues, including current infectious diseases, noncommunicable diseases, health inequities, natural disasters, global health insecurity, and maternal and neonatal health. As a chapter, we want to support Project HOPE’s mission by hosting monthly workshops with visitor Project HOPE speakers and doctors to educate the student community at Hunter College and expose pre-health students to the field. We hope to endorse equity, diversity, and inclusion in healthcare by hosting campaigns and fundraisers to directly assist in change and innovation, by creating a monthly newsletter for members, and by allowing students to volunteer for the cause (and receive a letter of reference from the organization).

To ensure a safe environment for Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Trans, Intersex, Asexual, Queer, Pansexual, and others (recognizing that our community is always growing – referred to herein as “LGBTQ+”) persons of all backgrounds and their allies by establishing a space free of sexism, racism, homophobia, transphobia, ableism and religionism.

HONOR SOCIETIES.club_name: Sexual Wellness Society of Hunter College
club_description: The purpose of this association is to initiate discussions of sexual wellness and how it concerns students of Hunter college. There will be events where trained professional guest speakers can talk about their experiences and provide advice for Hunter students. We hope to create a safe, curious, and welcoming environment for students to discuss, share experiences, and express feelings toward topics related to sexual wellness.

To mobilize individuals at Hunter College to join our petition drive and voice their support for the ratification of the Equal Rights Amendment. We firmly believe that every individual, regardless of their gender, deserves equal protection under the law. We aim to exert pressure and demand action on this critical constitutional amendment.

HONOR SOCIETIES.club_name: Student Veteran’s Club of Hunter College
club_description: The Club is a non-political, non-profit organization that brings people together through our shared respect, and desire to learn about and help our nation’s heroes; many of whom are our friends and classmates. This organization shall exist for the following purposes: (1) To provide a specific forum for student veterans affiliated with Hunter College that they may celebrate their unique experience, share their wealth of knowledge and unique perspectives, and lead others by their example. (2) To provide a safe, cooperative, and engaging environment for students who have no affiliation with the armed forces to engage with a group they may have little opportunity to engage with otherwise. (3) To support and recognize the service members of the United States Armed Forces, and their family members.

United for Youth is dedicated to improving the lives of children and teens currently in foster care. Our purpose is to advocate for them by spreading awareness of the obstacles they go through, helping them feel confident and secure, and providing them the needs for their success. By partnering with different organizations, we plan to help foster care children and teens create a brighter future for themselves. This is an excellent way to give back to our future generation.

The purpose of African Student Union is to represent and spread the rich culture and history of the African Continent to the Hunter College Community, as well as come together as a diverse group of people to uphold the values we share.
The purpose of this club is to learn about and celebrate Hellenic culture through the food, history, art, music, and dance of Greece.

The purpose of the Asian Student Union is to provide an inclusive space for promoting Asian cultures by exploring the Asian American identity, celebrating the achievements of Asians in America, and addressing harmful stereotypes. We will endorse our space to advance collaboration and unity among all Asian clubs. Doing so, we will enrich our student body by becoming a source of discussion and building a greater social consciousness on critical issues that impact Asian communities.

HONOR SOCIETIES.club_name: Bengali Student Association of Hunter College
club_description: The Bengali Student Association (BSA) aims to promote and celebrate the diverse cultures, traditions, and academic achievements of Bengali and South Asian students at Hunter College. BSA strives to create a supportive and inclusive community that fosters cultural awareness, intellectual growth, and social engagement through various educational, and social activities. BSA is also focused on community engagement through academic support and celebrate Bengali excellence.

Our mission is to be actively involved in the education and stimulation of the black student body. This is done not only through advocating for the dismantlement of pre-existing issues we face but, by providing a space and platform for black students to express themselves. We aim to build a warm community where our presence is not questioned despite our various backgrounds

The purpose of the Japanese Club is to foster interest in Japanese culture for students who would like to learn more about it, regardless if they have taken language or culture courses at the college level or not.

The mission of the Korean Students Association of Hunter College, a non-profit student run organization, shall be to promote Korean culture through cultural, social, political, and community service events. Our activities would range from providing informal social functions to promoting our educational and cultural foundation, which are intrinsically non-political and non-discriminating in nature. It is our belief that being away from our homeland should not compel us to lose our identity. It is our convicted intent through this association to not only enrich each other’s lives, but also to introduce our culture and extend our goodwill to other fellow students. We will also promote on and off-campus activities and is about giving back to the community. KSA is a resource to many students to market themselves for the purpose of future opportunities. As a member of KSA, students will be able to network themselves to others in different schools and majors by participating in events and meetings.

HONOR SOCIETIES.club_name: Latinos of the Caribbean of Hunter College
club_description: To build a safe environment to educate, celebrate, and experience the culture stemming from the different countries in Latin America and the Caribbean.

Our goal is to create a social and educational club in which everyone can share and celebrate the beauty of Mexico with our community here at Hunter. By establishing a community, we plan on creating awareness and educating others about ongoing issues in our country as well as cultural diversity within Mexico. We hope to simultaneously create a space in which members can network and form part of our Mexican familia!

The purpose of this club is to bring a community of Pakistani students together and create a safe space for them to connect. We want to inform people about current events in Pakistan and raise awareness and fund-raise for tragedies in Pakistan due to climate change etc.(recently there was a natural disaster which affected 30% of Pakistan’s land and displaced millions).

We also want to teach people about Pakistani culture such as native foods from each of the four provinces, music that differs as you travel across Pakistan and the way the style of dance vary from region to region. Pakistan is a country of many ethnicities, culture and language, it is nice to bring a sense of unity for Pakistanis at Hunter College.

Pilipinos of Hunter is committed to establish an inclusive community that celebrates Filipino culture, history and values. We organize workshops and networking opportunities with other communities that creates a more significant presence of Filipino-Americans. Through the knowledge and resources provided by the club we also hope to nurture the personal and cultural growth of our members.

The purpose of the Shikari Dance Team at Hunter College is to promote cultural diversity and awareness through the different styles of South Asian dance. The dance styles include but are not limited to Bollywood, Bhangra, Bharatnatyam, Kathak, etcetera. The team will perform and represent Hunter College at on/off-campus events & competitions as well as actively volunteering to give back to the growing diverse community.

The South Asian Cultural Club (SACC) looks to provide a space for the undergraduate students at Hunter where they can appreciate and express the South Asian Culture. We are focused on our purpose to spread knowledge about our culture and are open to sharing it with the diverse community at Hunter College.

HONOR SOCIETIES.club_name: Southwest Asian and North African Women Association
club_description: The South West Asian and North African Women Association is an effort to build a community within Hunter that supports and recognizes the achievements of women from the SWANA region. It will also allow for the education and appreciation of the unique yet intertwined cultures and history of the region.

Ukrainian Club of Hunter is a club for students to bring the college community together to learn about Ukrainian culture, history and connect students who have interest in the culture. Ukrainian Club of Hunter aims at providing the students with the safe space to learn about the above mentioned things and get support through events and get-togethers. Additionally, we hope to form a more united college community where students can connect with others of similar interests and become strong, informed, and interdisciplinary students through having events with other culture clubs at Hunter.

Uzbek Hawks is dedicated to creating a community for Uzbek individuals to collaborate, network and get to know one another. We want to provide a safe space to foster a better understanding of Uzbek culture and heritage while striving to uplift our members with a plethora of resources and opportunities along the way.

Vietnamese Student Association (VSA) at Hunter College serves to unite anyone with an affinity for and to promote Vietnamese culture and generate a community at Hunter College. We explore various volunteering and leadership opportunities through involvement with other Vietnamese and Asian organizations. With unity as the heart of this club, Hunter VSA will enable and develop stronger networks and community ties.

The CSA is a Catholic ministry whose primary mission is to serve the Hunter College, City University of New York community. We are called by Christ to build a faith community. Empowered by the Holy Spirit to be truly compassionate disciples, we are committed to the truth of the Gospel.

The goal of Hillel is to provide activities and a sense of community for all Jewish students on campus, with activities such as community service, educational programs about Judaism and Israel, and social events.

The goal of the Hindu Students Association is to create a space where people can learn about Hinduism through meetings and events. It also gives them an opportunity to meet other people and a space where they can feel comfortable practicing their religion.

The purpose of InterVarsity Christian Fellowship is to establish and advance at colleges and universities witnessing communities of students and faculty who follow Jesus as Savior and Lord: growing in love for God, God’s Word, God’s people of every ethnicity and culture, and God’s purposes in the world.

The purpose of the Muslim Student Association shall be to provide an organization where Muslims can assemble for prayer, community, and information about Islam. We shall also provide information to other Hunter College students about Islam and Muslims, and work towards dispelling any and all misconceptions about them in the community.

To provide Christian fellowship for our brothers and sisters in Christ at Hunter, to reach students at Hunter for Christ, to love and to serve Hunter College through our Christian witness, and preach Jesus Christ as the Risen Redeemer of Creation (Matthew 28:16-20). 2. To be (at the time of chartering) the sole Christian club at CUNY Hunter College with a doctrinal emphasis on the Reformed faith, as expressed in the historic creeds, Westminster Confession, and the “Five Solas:”
a. sola Scriptura (Scripture alone)b. sola fide (faith alone)c. sola gratia (grace alone)d. solus Christus (Christ alone)e. soli Deo gloria (to the glory of God alone)
The purpose of the Sikh Student Association is to raise awareness and grow appreciation for the religion of Sikhism among the Hunter College community.
To share awareness on the life of Jesus Christ and to grow together in fellowship as brothers and sisters in Christ.

Kappa Sigma is focused upon the Four Pillars of Fellowship, Leadership, Scholarship and Service. As a values-based men’s fraternity, Kappa Sigma strictly forbids hazing and fosters meaningful college experiences by offering progressive membership development and pledge education.

Rho Psi Eta is the only pre-health academic sorority at Hunter College, New York. Rho Psi Eta both embraces and upholds our pillars of academic integrity, community service, and sisterhood. We strive to help our young women of diverse backgrounds to pursue their interests and goals in the healthcare professions.
Instagram:http://www.instagram.com/rhopsietahunter/

HONOR SOCIETIES.club_name: Decolonize Social Work Collective of Hunter College
club_description: Theta Phi Gamma fosters and maintains the inspired ideals of friendship, scholarship, and encouragement upon which we were founded. We aim to develop the highest standard of personal integrity and character. Our organization promotes academic excellence and supports personal achievement while providing a social balance. Our mission is to gather a diverse group of undergraduate students to connect over philanthropic causes as well as bonding socially.
Creating transformative healing forums that explore
the wisdom, resilience, ways of being, and sovereignty of Indigenous and marginalized people impacted by the destructive legacy of colonialism.

GUAPA is Hunter UAP’s student organization dedicated to helping students of the Urban Affairs and Planning programs make the most of their academic experience. Activities include events, field trips, movie nights, conferences and networking with fellow graduates not only from Hunter UAP but also from similar programs in New York City, the Northeast, and around the nation.
MASO’s purpose is to establish a sense of community within the Art History Masters of Arts program. We aim to connect current students to each other and to alumni in our field.

HONOR SOCIETIES.club_name: National Student Speech Language Hearing Association (NSSLHA)
club_description: The National Student Speech-Language-Hearing Association aims to advocate for those treated within the scope of speech-language pathology and audiology by raising awareness about communication sciences and disorders.

To raise awareness for healthy lifestyles, healthy eating, and overall wellness through events and functions. To orient incoming students in the major and assist them in their effort to adjust to the new community as well as fostering interaction between members, students from other majors, and professionals. To function as representatives of the Nutrition and Food Science programs to students, faculty, and staff of Hunter College. To utilize our nutrition knowledge to create easy to understand nutrition information for the public population.

The purposes of the Society, in the words of the Constitution, are to develop and promote interest in classical study among the students of colleges and universities; to promote closer fraternal relationship among students who are interested in classical study, including inter- campus relationship; to engage generally in an effort to stimulate interest in classical study, and in the history, art, and literature of ancient Greece and Rome.
Encourage, stimulate, and maintain excellence in scholarship of the members in the field of psychology.

The Dance Now Club was formed in Fall 2013 as the umbrella organization for ALL of the pre-existing dance clubs. The purpose of Dance Now is to bring the dance interests of the individual clubs mentioned above together as a collective organization.

HONOR SOCIETIES.club_name: Gen K K-Pop Dance Cover Team at Hunter College
club_description: Gen-K is a K-Pop Dance Cover Team at Hunter College that establishes a community for individuals with a passion for K-Pop choreography. Members will have the opportunity to collaborate on learning and filming multiple K-Pop dance covers throughout the semester. The team will represent Hunter College in on and off-campus events, competitions, and performances.
The purpose of our club is to rehearse weekly and perform various contemporary music using only our voices to promote creativity and spread positive messages.

The Intonation Club was formed in Fall 2013 as the umbrella organization for ALL of the pre-existing music clubs. The purpose of Intonation is to bring the musical interests of the individual dubs mentioned above together as a collective organization.

The Social and Ballroom Dance Club was founded with the goal of fostering a fun and social environment around partnered dance styles as well as representing Hunter College in collegiate Latin and Ballroom dance competitions. Our club welcomes dancers of all levels and backgrounds, including those interested in learning how to dance and experienced dancers.
Hunter Theatre Company provides students with the opportunity to explore and gain experience in the performing arts through workshops, seminars, events, and student lead productions.

The purpose of the Virsa Bhangra (dance) Club, is to allow students with a Punjabi background to reconnect with their culture and also provide opportunity for all the students at Hunter College to explore and appreciate Punjabi culture and traditions through dance.
The Envoyis the student-run news publication of Hunter College. We publish local and university-wide news meaningful to our community.

The Hunted Hero Comics publication is established in order to produce and publish original comics written and illustrated by Hunter College students. All students may submit their original works to the club to be considered for publication.

News publication to recount current nursing issues in forms of news, opinion, and feature, a yearbook dedicated to the senior undergraduate nursing class, and other types of media, such as video and media presentation, for documentation or exhibition during events held throughout the course of the nursing program.

The Olivetree Reviewis the arts and literary publication of Hunter College. Every semester the Olivetree Review releases an issue with the published works of Hunter students covering all forms of art including visual, poetry, prose, and drama. Additionally, this club hosts events in support of the arts such as Open Mics, Paint Nights, and workshops.

The Photographers Collective seeks to encourage the growth of emerging photographers, artists, and thinkers at Hunter College. We aim to supplement Hunter College’s photography curriculum through technical workshops, artist talks, a biannual publication, group shows, and critical conversation about photography. We offer a platform from which to foster community, learning, and creativity.
The purpose of this club is to create a space to discuss and write about politics and current events.

The purpose of Psych News is to educate and inform the Hunter College community and to provide students (especially Psychology students) with a forum to share and discuss their interest in psychology.
WHCS Radio’s purpose is to give a broadcast platform to Hunter College Students to showcase student musicians, speak upon current events, and express creative freedom.

The American Red Cross in Greater New York is a nonprofit humanitarian organization, led by volunteers, that provides relief to individuals affected by disasters, and help people prevent, prepare for, and respond to emergencies. The Red Cross Club of Hunter College, a division of the American Red Cross in Greater New York, consists of students working to uphold the ideals of the Red Cross movement. Our mission is to participate in service projects that will impact our community and the world. We offer student members many opportunities for self-development and the ability to choose activities that will address the community’s greatest needs. Through community service and development, we hope to create a community of dedicated students who are passionate about making a difference.

The purpose of Be The Match is to spread awareness of the severity of Blood Cancers and Disorders in our world today. Our goal is to gather as many volunteers as possible (of all race and ethnicities) to join the registry.

Music is Medicine is a community of student-musicians interested in healthcare and community service. Members sing or play an instrument for patients in New York-Presbyterian/Weill Cornell. Performing for patients is a highly rewarding experience; music is known to reduce patient stress while brightening the hospital atmosphere. For pre-health students, this club serves as a creative outlet outside of the STEM coursework and is a great opportunity to gain clinical experience.

Project Sunshine empowers a dynamic and dedicated corps of over 15,000 volunteers to bring programming – recreational (arts), educational (tutoring and mentoring) and social service (HIV and nutritional counseling) – to over 100,000 children facing medical challenges and their families in 100 major cities across the United States and in five international satellite sites: Canada, China, Israel, Kenya and Puerto Rico.

Our purpose is to connect a growing community of anime, manga and Japanese culture enthusiasts. This club is an all inclusive and diverse space for all whether they are dedicated fans or simply interested in media separate from traditional Japanese culture.

HONOR SOCIETIES.club_name: Art for Healing Club of Hunter College
club_description: Our club’s purpose is to showcase the benefits of art both for mental health and for career’s sake. Art is often a hobby used to relieve stress. It can be used to entertain patients and is a recognized form of relief to alleviate tension. For pre-health-related professions, art can also improve diagnosis, train your eye, and improve manual dexterity. No previous art experience is needed! We welcome all who wish to relax and make new friends via the usage of different forms of art, all while gaining a new hobby in the process!

The Book Club of Hunter College is a club for students to bring the college community together to learn about and discuss the selected books of the month. The Book Club of Hunter College explores many types of stories and takes into account what our students want to read – providing them with the agency necessary to talk about what they love. Additionally, we hope to form a more united college community where students can connect with others of similar interests and become strong, informed, and interdisciplinary students.

Chai Coffee Lit is a community safe space for BIPOC LGBTQ students which functions as bookclub; and is aimed at investigating texts at the intersection of Queer theory and Feminism by people of Color.
We provide an environment in which people can play and conversate, where you can relax, play, and discuss chess.

The aim of the club is to build a friendly community in which to foster a comfortable, productive, therapeutic, interactive, social working environment for members to experience, craft, appreciate, practice, and engage in fiber arts. This club offers a wonderful opportunity for those inexperience to this classic and traditional form of art to develop their creative abilities/potentials and a newfound appreciation for fiber arts. Members will be inspired and challenged to learn or teach others how to craft various projects and clothing out of yarn while utilizing many different techniques, simple or complex, depending on skill level. Other activities including but not limited to: learning the design process, learning about health benefits and advantages of fiber art, choosing the right materials for the project, learning tips and tricks, improvising and customizing patterns, learning how to read patterns and construct geometric shapes, keeping track of stitches, and more. Furthermore, members are welcomed to share their knowledge in fiber arts and encouraged to be actively involved.

The mission of Healing Blessings is to elevate the quality of life for individuals with neurodegenerative diseases like MS, Alzheimer’s, and Parkinson’s. This purpose is realized through the provision of meaningful engagement, heartfelt companionship, and cognitive enrichment. By actively participating in events, zoom meetings, and visits to care facilities, students will engage directly with the residents, creating genuine connections and making a positive impact on their lives.

Healing Blessings is dedicated to cultivating a nurturing community. This community is centered around imparting joy and solace, not only to the individuals coping with neurodegenerative diseases but also to the participating students. Through their involvement, students will acquire invaluable insights into caregiving, empathy, and the profound effects of meaningful interactions. These experiences will contribute to their personal growth, fostering compassion and understanding that will extend beyond their time in the organization.

Healthcare Business Club of Hunter College is a secular, student-operated volunteer organization whose mission is to promote the image of Hunter College as an institution that produces leaders who have an impact on the business of health care. This mission is achieved by providing a space for students to learn the business of health care, prepare for and pursue careers/innovations in health care, and raise awareness of malpractice and business ethics that occur in the healthcare industry.

Members of this club will go through workshops, speaker events, and mentorship by professionals in various healthcare administration fields. Through these experiences, members will be able to immerse themselves in topics including but not limited to: Healthcare Consulting, Health Policy and Management, Finance and Investment, Health IT/Tech. Our goal is for our members to gain insight on how to become business professionals in the medical field.

Investment & Trading Society aims to cultivate connections among Hunter College students who are interested in learning about the fundamentals of investing. In addition to gaining an understanding of financial markets, students are provided with resources such as networking events, guest speakers, panels, and conferences at or outside of Hunter College.
